## VaultKeeper.setDevelopmentMode() method

Add or remove an executable from the development-mode whitelist.

When an executable is in the development-mode list, identity verification (TOFU hash checking) is skipped for that executable during `setup()`<!-- -->. This is intended for local development workflows where the binary changes frequently.

**Signature:**

```typescript
setDevelopmentMode(executablePath: string, enabled: boolean): Promise<void>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

executablePath


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

Absolute path to the executable to add or remove.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

enabled


</td><td>

boolean


</td><td>

Pass `true` to add the executable to the list, `false` to remove it.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

Promise&lt;void&gt;
